channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Bacolod City, Iloilo City now included in areas under extended ECQ
item.description: The new coronavirus has already infected 8,212 people in the Philippines. Of the number, 558 have died, while 1,023 have recovered.

item.title: Roque stands by 'Taiwan, part of China' remark
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "We have always had one position with this regard, together with other countries in the world," Roque said.

item.title: DILG asked about 100 barangay chiefs, five mayors to explain supposed quarantine violations
item.description: Interior Secretary Eduardo Año said Thursday the department has asked about 100 barangay chiefs and five mayors to explain their supposed violation of quarantine guidelines.

item.title: DOH reports Philippines' youngest COVID-19 survivor
item.description: DOH wrote in a Facebook post that a 16-day-old baby recovered from COVID-19.

item.title: DOH: Target testing goals may not be met
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health will not be able to meet the target of conducting 8,000 tests daily for the coronavirus disease 2019 by today.

item.title: Angara eyes ban on handshakes
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Sen. Sonny Angara yesterday filed a resolution seeking to discourage handshaking to help prevent the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 and other germs.

item.title: ‘Isolating sick key to restarting economy’
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Presidential Adviser for Entrepreneurship Joey Concepcion is pushing for the government’s adoption of a strategy of isolating the sick and not the healthy to respond to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic and restart the economy.

item.title: PNP admits intrusions into ECQ violators’ privacy
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) yesterday admitted there were cases wherein police officers have intruded on the privacy of citizens in the enforcement of the enhanced community quarantine.

item.title: No June school opening — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Classes cannot reopen in June because young people could have the most contact with those who are vulnerable to the coronavirus disease 2019, Malacañang said yesterday. ?

item.title: Government looking for other sources of SAP funds
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Social Welfare and Development is looking for more funds in a bid to expand the number of beneficiaries of the Social Amelioration Program to cover “left-out” low-income families excluded from the list of those eligible to get cash aid amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.
